bibl.title: Yann LE BOHEC (Éd.), L'Afrique, la Gaule, la Religion à l'époque romaine. Mélanges à la mémoire de Marcel Le Glay
bibl.note: P. Clermont Ganneau (= S.B. VI, 9227-9228), an epikrisis certificate, mentions Q. Allius Pudentillus, praefectus of the cohors I Augusta praetoria Lusitanorum. In line 23 a plausible reading is ÑIpp≈no[w - - ?]. Was Q. Allius Pudentillus a native of Hippo Regius? And did Pudentillus benefit from the patronage of a praefectus Aegypti, L. Munatius Felix, under whom he served? Was L. Munatius Felix too an African? <Hippono[s - - ?]>
